result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Commit no further criminal acts during the period of this agreement. Have no contact with M.M.H., dob 8/29/1975. Defendant understands that "no contact" means no direct or indirect contact, whether in person, by phone, or by mail, and whether initiated by the defendant or by someone on the defendant's behalf. The only exceptions to this condition will be for contact as required by any mediation agreement, counseling, or letter of apology required by this DAGP. Have no unsupervised contact with any children, other than the Defendant's own. Have no unsupervised contact with any person suffering from a mental, developmental or emotional disability.

Defendant will, on or before 30 days of the date of this agreement, send a written letter of apology addressed to M.M.H. of not less than 300 words and clearly apologizing for the Defendant's sexual assault of M.M.H. to the District Attorney's office. Upon approval, the District Attorney's office will forward the letter to the victim. Have a sex offender assessment with a qualified assessor approved in advance by the District Attorney's Office. A written report of the results of said assessment and all recommendations of it to be provided to the District Attorney's office at least 10 days before the date of this agreement. Submit and comply with any and all recommendations of the sex offender assessment. Compliance shall begin within 30 days of this agreement. Provide a written report of the compliance with all recommendations of the sex offender assessment to the District Attorney's office within 30 days of completion, or not less than 60 days before the date set for sentencing/dismissal below, whichever is sooner. Defendant shall provide a copy of this agreement, along with the Criminal Complaint, to any counselor and sign any and all releases necessary to allow the counselor (or agency) to report compliance or lack thereof to the District Attorney's Office. Any assessments done without this agreement and the Criminal Complaint(s) being supplied to the counselor will be considered violations of this agreement and not be accepted. This agreement may be revoked or the defendant may have to complete a new assessment.

supervisions.notes: $500 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay.
Good time and Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: for Sentence Modification. Per court, partial approval. 72 hour furlough to address medical concerns (should have been handled during 60 day report extension). Further requests unlikely to be granted.
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement

Defendant Anthony G. Quinn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State advises of Defendant's compliance on deferred Counts 1, 2. Court reviews conditions contained within agreement, approves agreement. State advises that victim is present. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond continues as is.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 24, 2025 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony G. Quinn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files Amended Information. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2, 3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, finds basis to accept pleas, withholds acceptance of pleas on Counts 1 and 2, finds Defendant guilty of Count 3. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony G. Quinn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense apologizes for misreprentation to Court about plea/sentencing, has one additional issue to discuss with DA Pelrine. Defendant agrees with Defense's comments to Court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
from Atty Reetz requesting rescheduling
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-27-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Anthony G. Quinn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that case will resolve, State has tendered offer, but one provision regarding felony conviction may impact Defendant's ability to be caregiver for his special needs children, will be getting State's response to employment application, requests plea in 30 days. State has no objection. Bond continues as is. Court removes jury trial from calendar.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
for Subpoena for Documents, Affidavit in Support, Subpoena for Documents, Return
Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Set for trial (first 2 day time available after May 15) and pre-trial. Pre-trial motions due by April 1. State advises that offer is withdrawn.
by State

Defendant Anthony G. Quinn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Anthony G. Quinn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.   Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Set prelim. Defense advises that case can be set for status/waiver.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 1/6/15.

Defendant Anthony G. Quinn in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 1/26/15, 10:00.
